visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a stock chart with the following specifications: Chart type: stock, Chart title: 'AAPL Stock Price', Axes and labels styling: x-axis with crosshair enabled, y-axis with opposite positioning and crosshair label formatting to two decimal places, Data series: one series named 'AAPL' with data fetched from 'https://demo-live-data.highcharts.com/aapl-c.json', Custom colors: not specified, Additional configurations: chart with right margin of 50px, styled mode enabled, range selector with one selected, and tooltip with two decimal places.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a stock chart for the AAPL stock price. The chart type is set to 'stock', which is appropriate for time series data like stock prices. The title of the chart is 'AAPL Stock Price', and the x-axis has crosshair enabled for better visualization of specific points. The y-axis is configured to appear on the opposite side of the chart, with crosshair labels formatted to two decimal places for precision. The y-axis labels are also formatted to two decimal places and are slightly offset for better readability. The chart has a right margin of 50 pixels and is set to styled mode, which allows for more control over the visual styling. The range selector is enabled with one default selection, and the tooltip displays values with two decimal places. The data for the series named 'AAPL' is expected to be fetched from an external source and will be dynamically populated into the chart.
